      • send

        public Future<IAcknowledgement> send(IMessage message)
        Description copied from interface: IParticipant
        send a message to common reality. If the message is an IRequest the Future will contain the IAcknowledgement message. If the message is not an IRequest, the Future will contain null
        This is usually used to send object data and commands. The typical pattern is to send the ObjectDataRequest followed by the ObjectCommandRequest to commit the new data. While the underlying communications will ensure in order delivery, that delivery is dependent not upon the order of send commands, rather the order in which the messages are transformed to a sendable representation (i.e. stream of bytes). This is not usually an issue unless you send the data request on one thread and the command request on another. Since the encoding of the data will typically take longer, the command may arrive before the data. If you use this model, you should probably wait for the acknowledgment of the data transmission before sending the command.
        Specified by:
        send in interface IParticipant
        Returns:
